attributes.description:
Access to the Kendall/MIT Station will remain open and accessible on the Main Street side of the station throughout this construction.
 
The pedestrian plaza between Carleton Street and Main Street in Kendall Square will be closed due to the construction of an underground garage. 
 
Customers are encouraged to utilize alternative paths to/from the station using the paths on Ames Street, Dock Street, or Wadsworth Street.

attributes.description:
Customers looking for service to Central Square should continue to Kendall Station and utilize free shuttle bus service to Central Square. Please see station personnel for assistance requesting the shuttle. 
If boarding at Central Square, a free shuttle bus will be available to Kendall Station.  As an alternative, cross the street and take Elevator 860 to the Alewife-bound platform. Take the Red Line to Harvard Square and switch to an Ashmont-/Braintree-bound train.

attributes.description:
Please use caution accessing the station and on the platforms while crews work to make these necessary improvements.

The two staircases at the end of the platform away from the station building will both be closed for approximately six weeks once work is completed on the staircases by the building. Please allow additional travel time to be on the platform 5-10 minutes prior to the train's scheduled departure. 

Affected routes:
Haverhill Line
Lowell Line

attributes.description:
Red Line train service will resume at the start of service on the following Monday. All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. 

Customers should expect delays in service due to speed restrictions for a minimum of 48 hours after the weekend track work.

Shuttling the following stops:
Kendall/MIT (pick-up/drop-off at Marriott Hotel)
Charles/MGH (inbound shuttle buses at Cambridge St @ Grove St, outbound at Cambridge St @ Charles St near the Liberty Hotel)
Park Street (pick-up/drop-off on Tremont St @ Temple Place) 

For more information: https://www.mbta.com/longfellow

attributes.header: Bridge construction is complete and normal boarding patterns have resumed at Bradford and Haverhill stations. Please board all inbound trains on the inbound platform and outbound trains on the outbound platform.
attributes.short_header: Bridge construction is complete and normal inbound/outbound boarding patterns have resumed at Bradford & Haverhill stations.

attributes.description:
The elevators are out of service to facilitate the replacement of the elevator cabs, hydraulic machines, and associated electrical work. 

Shuttle bus service is provided between Tufts Medical Center (Washington St entrance) and Back Bay Stations. Customers in need of shuttle bus service are asked to see station personnel or utilize a station call box to request assistance. 

As an alternative, customers can also utilize Silver Line service to Chinatown Station. 

Click here for more information: https://www.mbta.com/tufts-elevators

Affected routes:
Orange Line

attributes.description:
Customers are advised that the pedestrian route for customers transferring from the Green and Orange Line exits at Causeway and Beverly St into North Station Commuter Rail will be moved slightly to accommodate ongoing construction work. 

After crossing Causeway St, pedestrians will use a protected walkway along the east side of Legends Way, directly abutting Portal Park. The walkway will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.

As an alternative, customers may consider utilizing the west exit from North Station Commuter Rail due to congestion.
attributes.header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.
attributes.short_header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.

attributes.description:
Customers looking to exit the Orange Line at Tufts Medical Center should exit at Back Bay and utilize shuttle bus service to Tufts. Customers looking to board at Tufts Medical Center should utilize shuttle bus service to Back Bay to make Orange Line connections. 
Customers in need of shuttle bus service are asked to see station personnel or utilize a station call box to request assistance.

As an alternative, customers can also utilize Silver Line service between Temple Place, Tufts Medical Center, and Chinatown Station.  

The elevators are out of service to facilitate the replacement of the elevator cabs, hydraulic machines, and associated electrical work.

attributes.description:
For access to Braintree Station during this closure, travel down to the first floor and use the pedestrian crosswalk to enter the station at the street level.
This closure is due to the South Shore Parking Garages Improvements and Renovations Project. The pedestrian bridge will be replaced by a new garage lobby featuring elevators and stairwells.

Affected routes:
Red Line
210
230
236
Middleborough/Lakeville Line
Kingston/Plymouth Line

attributes.description:
Inbound trains will depart Wachusett as scheduled. They will bypass Fitchburg Station and meet the bus shuttle from Fitchburg Station at North Leominster. This tie replacement work is expected to be completed by April 27th. 

Passengers traveling inbound from Fitchburg Station will board a Paul Revere shuttle bus at Fitchburg Station and be transported to North Leominster to connect with the inbound train for continued inbound service. 

Passengers traveling from Wachusett to Fitchburg should notify the the train crew on the platform at Wachusett prior to departure or arrange alternative transportation to Fitchburg Station. 

Outbound passengers bound for Fitchburg Station will alight at North Leominster where they will board the shuttle bus to Fitchburg Station. 

Passengers planning to travel from Fitchburg to Wachusett on these mid-day trains should call Customer Service at 617-222-3200.

Affected trips: 
403 (7:43 am from North Station) 
405 (8:45 am from North Station)
attributes.header: Weekday trains will bypass Fitchburg Station from approximately 9:00 am until 4:30 pm due to a tie replacement project. A shuttle bus will be provided between Fitchburg and North Leominster.
attributes.short_header: Weekday trains bypass Fitchburg from approx 9:00 am- 4:30 pm due to tie replacement. Shuttle provided between Fitchburg & N. Leominster

attributes.description:
The MBTA will install federally mandated Positive Train Control (PTC) systems along the Franklin Line to improve safety by reducing train collisions and derailments. This work will require weekend shutdowns on the line between Forge Park/495 and Readville, where passengers will connect to train service.  

Shuttle buses will be free and passengers will pay for train service from Readville to Boston.
attributes.header: Weekend train service on the Franklin Line will be replaced by ADA accessible shuttle buses, making all regularly scheduled stops, between Forge Park/495 and Readville stations from April 7th through May 27th during the installation of PTC.
attributes.short_header: All weekend Franklin Line service will be bused between Forge Park & Readville from 4/7-5/27. Visit www.mbta.com/franklin for schedule info.

attributes.description:
The following outbound trains will be replaced by a bus shuttle between Canton Jct. & Stoughton:
- 909 (9:45 am from S. Station)
- 911 (1:20 pm from S. Station), which will be held for approximately 10 minutes between Hyde Park & Route 128.

The following inbound trains will be replaced by a bus shuttle:
- 910 (10:40 am from Stoughton) will be bused between Stoughton & Route 128. The bus will then continue to Dedham Corp. Ctr. for inbound train service aboard Franklin Train 712 (11:31 from Dedham Corp / due at S. Station at 11:54 am).
- 912 (2:15 pm from Stoughton) will be bused between Stoughton & Canton Jct. The bus shuttle will stop at Route 128 for drop-off only & then travel directly to South Station, without making a station stop at Back Bay, and will arrive around 3:30 pm. For inbound train service from Route 128, take Providence Train 822 (2:43 pm from Route 128).

Inbound bus shuttles will depart Stoughton at the scheduled train departure time.
attributes.header: On Mondays, Tuesdays, & Wednesdays from 4/23 - 5/16, shuttle buses will replace service on four mid-day Stoughton trains while we test equipment for PTC.
attributes.short_header: On Monday thru Wednesday, from 4/23 - 5/16, buses will replace service on four mid-day Stoughton trains to allow for PTC work.

attributes.description:
To assist with the Wollaston Station renovation, bus shuttles will replace Red Line service in both directions between Braintree and North Quincy stations during select weekends over the course of the project.

All bus shuttle stops are accessible for persons with disabilities.

Regularly scheduled train service will resume at the start of service on the following Monday.

Affected stops:
North Quincy
Wollaston
Quincy Center
Quincy Adams
Braintree

For more information: https://www.mbta.com/wollaston
attributes.header: Bus shuttles replace Red Line service between North Quincy & Braintree starting at 9:00pm Friday, May 4, through end of service on Sunday, May 6 due to the Wollaston Station renovation.
attributes.short_header: Bus shuttles replace Red Line between N Quincy & Braintree starting at 9pm Fri, May 4, through end of service on Sun, May 6

attributes.description:

attributes.description:
Wollaston is being transformed into a modern, fully accessible facility, making the entirety of the Red Line 100% accessible. 

Trains bypass Wollaston station traveling between North Quincy and Quincy Center. Shuttle buses run between North Quincy, Wollaston, and Quincy Center stations with the same frequency as the Red Line. Shuttle bus stops are fully accessible. 

423 parking spaces are available at Wollaston Station during the closure. Follow @MBTA for updates. 

Visit www.mbta.com/wollaston for details.
attributes.header: Wollaston Station has closed for renovation. Free bus shuttles run from Wollaston to North Quincy and Quincy Center.
attributes.short_header: Wollaston Station has closed for renovation. Free bus shuttles run from Wollaston to North Quincy and Quincy Center.
